simplified sentece that has caused numerous edit wars -- if it must go back in, it needs a source (in whatever form it takes)
claim is made by a professor in a book about the Harding family, therefore it is a reliable source
remove untrue statement, Warren Harding had African ancestry
No, he was NOT the first self-identified African American elected to the Senate from the Dem. Party, Carol Mosely Braun was. But he WAS the first MALE to be so elected. Please check your history.
his african american identity can be written into the article in an npov way, like this, "self-identified". The problematic nature of the term is addressed in the article [[African American]]
remove the"That same year, he became the first man of African descent to win election to the United States" their have been other americans of african descent that have served.
/* Senate career */ just style, I suppose
Yeah, well maybe some Senators are hiding the fact that they are 1/32 Vietnamese or something--SO WHAT? Sans sources, leave such speculative gibberish out.

qualifying "first man of African descent" part... some previous senators are suspected of hiding some ancestry

Added some factual balance to the Keyes-Obama campaign.
Read the Link Jersyko. The Coburn proposal specifically tried to shift Bridge to Nowhere Funding to Hurrican Katrina. Obama voted against it.
rv - kept only the first edit by the anon; support for the transportation bill does not mean support for the bridge to nowhere
/* Senate career */ Added support for Bridge to Nowhere
/* Senate Campaign - General */ expanded Keyes vs. Obama section
Sorry, but the lead paragraph should be limited to that which makes this person notable. No offense against his church--it's just not significant enough to be in the lead.
Obama made HISTORY with his election--this fact is the reason why, and is important to include in the introduction.
